newsitem.title: DENMARK: Denmark postpones awaited telecom laws.
newsitem.headline: Denmark postpones awaited telecom laws.

text.p: Danish Research Minister Frank Jensen said on Thursday he was postponing until February, legislation on technical aspects of telecommunications liberalisation in order to fine-tune the new laws.
The main body of legislation, setting out principles of an open market and the end of state-owned Tele Danmark A/S 's monopoly, took effect on July 1.

Rules on inter-connectivity between operators, access to infrastructure and tariff ceilings had been expected this autumn but Jensen said that attempting to complete the package by the end of the year would result in "jerry-built legislation."

"It is essential that we get a solid bill that can assure real competition on the free telecommunications market," he said in a statement, adding that he had invited opposition parties to add their proposals to those of the ruling coalition partners.
